meanings.definition: A person who operates a linotype machine.
meanings.sent1: The linotypers at the printing press work diligently to set type for the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The linotypers in the old printing shop were skilled at quickly setting type for the daily edition.
meanings.sent3: The linotypers had a race to see who could set the type the fastest, creating a fun competition.
meanings.sent4: The linotypers were like composers, arranging letters and words to create beautiful printed pages.
meanings.sent5: The linotypers' fingers danced across the keys, bringing the printed words to life.

meanings.definition: Plural form of linotyper, referring to multiple individuals who operate linotype machines.
meanings.sent1: The linotypers gathered around the machine, discussing the best way to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent2: In the printing factory, the linotypers worked together seamlessly to produce newspapers around the clock.
meanings.sent3: The linotypers formed a union to advocate for better working conditions and fair wages.
meanings.sent4: The linotypers were a well-oiled machine, each member playing a crucial role in the printing process.
meanings.sent5: The linotypers' teamwork was evident in the flawless layout of the newspaper pages.
